answers.answer: Yes, that is a bit high for a fasting. Normal fasting blood sugars should be under 100. 100-125 is considered pre-diabetes and 126 and over is considered diabetic. I would take her in and have her tested so you know where to go from here. Also if she is diabetic, be sure they find her Type by antibody testing.
Thank you Zoelula!  I will make an appointment for her.

Not really. I have Type I and my glucose levels elevate if I don't eat.  Her body is trying to send her sugar for energy (and food), so her levels are going to be up.  Start having her eat low-sugar snacks every couple of hours, and try to eat 4-6 SMALL meals a day.  In any case, a visit to the doctor can't hurt!

Diabetics and non-diabetics have different blood sugar patterns; this person has not been diagnosed yet.  If someone has a fasting blood sugar between 100 and 125 that is, by definition a diagnosis of pre-diabetes, though it is usually a good idea to confirm it with an A1C which tests blood sugar over a period of a couple months.

question: What are normal blood sugar ranges for a teen-ager? I test my children periodically because I have T2 Diabetes. A few days ago, I tested my 17 year old daughter and it was 111 after not eating for 4 hours. So, I tested her again in the morning to get a fasting Blood Sugar and it was 123. Should I be worried and should I take her in to get her tested?
title: A question about my daughter
